intro: Noronhia ecoronulata, commonly known as the crownless noronhia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to the tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils within forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
